page.title: 08BECKY'S INTERVIEW CONTINUED
page.content: A.Two sisters delivered post in a horse drawn cart. Q.What recreation was there? A.Very little for girls and teenagers, but there was a Boys Brigade. Q.What major changes can you remember? A.We got 2 private bus services and a permanent place for the library, before it was a tin hut. Q.How did the wars affect the village? A.Very little indeed,you could hear the planes going over to Bristol and one bomb did drop in a field outside the village. It seems that until the develop_ ment of the motor_car and the roads, the village changed very little over the year.
